newsitem.title: USA: NYS official blasts cash bonus for Disney exec.
newsitem.headline: NYS official blasts cash bonus for Disney exec.

text.p: The New York State Comptroller, criticizing a large severance package that Walt Disney Co is paying its former president, said Monday he would vote against a cash bonus for the current chairman.
H. Carl McCall, New York State comptroller, is the trustee of the state's Common Retirement Fund, which holds 3.4 million of shares of the Walt Disney Co.
McCall, who also said he was concerned about the company's governance, based his objections in part on Disney's decision to pay such a big severance package to its former president, Michael Ovitz.
"I don't know how the Board can justify paying over $100 million to someone who worked for the company only 14 months," McCall said, in prepared remarks.
While saluting the company's performance, McCall continued, "It's hard to understand why a Board that has directed a company that has performed so well could do something so stupid."
He said the board failed to demonstrate enough independence, saying "Disney needs board members who do not have personal or professional relationships with management."

The state fund will withhold its votes for the five nominees to the company's board at its annual meeeting on Tuesday, when it also is expected to take up a proposed cash bonus for Michael Eisner, chairman and chief executive officer.
